page.title: 06Housing.
page.content: Most property has been built of locally quarried granite with slate roofing. Most property in Milton Coombe dates back to the 16th century when many were used by local industry i.e. four were part of the cider press. Remains of such industry are often found today as home owners renovate properties, increasing house prices dramatically. More modern brick built houses form a small estate of six properties in the village and a few others may be found close to the Moorland Links Hotel. Maristow Estate property is generally rented from the estate by its employees, a pattern which has changed little over the years. One small area that offers change is at Barn Farm (1702) where the owner wishes to develop 18 acres to holiday cottages and caravan park arousing strong local opposition.
